intro: Palicourea guianensis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western guianense palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. It is often found in humid, lowland forest environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
